snippet: Egypt’s rulers gave new credence to a court case against Mohamed Morsi and members of the Muslim Brotherhood, marking another blow to the group by the military-backed government.
abstract: Egypt’s new rulers give new credence to court case against Mohamed Morsi and members of Muslim Brotherhood over their escape from prison during uprising that toppled Morsi's predecessor Hosni Mubarak; case is transferred from appeals court to State Security prosecutor for further investigation, marking another blow to military-backed government.

byline.contributor: Sarah Mousa contributed reporting from Cairo, and Rick Gladstone from New York.

lead_paragraph: Egypt’s rulers gave new credence to a court case against Mohamed Morsi and members of the Muslim Brotherhood, marking another blow to the group by the military-backed government.

headline.main: Egypt Calls for New Look at Morsi Prison Escape in 2011
headline.print_headline: Egypt Calls for New Look At Morsi Prison Escape
